III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-
Description resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A month ago, inappropriate touching occurred between multiple
youth at the facility. It is unknown if the staff responded after they
were informed. Another staff member has spoken inappropriately
to youth regarding sexuality.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
02/17/2023.
The allegations about a staff member speaking inappropriately to
youth regarding sexuality was addressed in Special Investigation
2023C0000243 and there were no findings.
The complainant was anonymous.
I interviewed MDHHS Specialist via telephone on 02/17/2023. She
reported the facility had conducted an internal investigation
12/30/2023 and the youths denied any inappropriate touching.
I met with Consumer Rights Officer at the facility on 02/21/2023.
Consumer Rights Officer reported he conducted an internal
investigation regarding an incident report submitted on 12/26/2023
of allegation for inappropriate touching by Youth A with three other
youths on the wing. He conducted an internal investigation,
interviewed the four youths involved, and reviewed video footage.
Youth A admitted while watching television with Youth B, she
rubbed her leg against Youth B’s leg to comfort Youth B, because
Youth B was upset. Youth A also said there was an incident when
Youth B was showering, and she opened the door but closed it
right away. He interviewed Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D and
they denied any inappropriate touching by Youth A. He reviewed
the video footage and reported that Youth A and B were sitting on
a two-seat chair with a blanket on their lap, and two staff members
were sitting behind them. He could not see anything inappropriate
happening, but the blanket on the youth’s lap was a barrier. This
was addressed with staff to ensure there are no barriers when
2

supervising the youths. He also said he reviewed several days of
video footage and was only able to see one bathroom incident
involving Youth A. Youth B went to the shower around 2:50 pm,
and at 3:00 pm Youth walked onto the wing, walked up to the
bathroom door, knocked on the door, opened the door, peaked in,
and closed the door. He said the whole exchange was less than
30 seconds. Youth A was moved to blue wing, Youth C and D are
on the Green Wing, and Youth B has been discharged from the
program and is now in an Independent Living Program.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 02/21/2023. Youth A is 14
years old and has been at the facility for eight months. Youth A is
on the Blue Wing. Youth A said she and Youth B were sitting on
the couch watching television, they had a blanket on their lap,
their legs were touching, but nothing inappropriate happened. She
said she did rub Youth B’s leg because Youth B was upset, but
she denied touching her inappropriately. She said there were two
staff members sitting behind them. Youth A said there was an
incident in December where she kissed Youth C while they were
in the bathroom. She could not provide a date or time. She said
staff were present, but she sneaked into the bathroom when staff
were not looking.
I interviewed Youth C at the facility on 02/21/2023. Youth C has
been at the facility for one year and is on the Green Wing. Youth
C denied any inappropriate touching and denied ever being in the
bathroom with Youth A. She said Youth A has made up lies about
her and Youth D. Youth C said staff are always on the wing
supervising them. She reported no concerns regarding staff or the
facility.
I attempted to interview Youth D at the facility on 02/21/2023, but
she refused to be interviewed.
I received an email from Youth A’s Foster Care Specialist 1 on
02/27/2023. She stated Youth A is on 1:1 staff supervision due to
mental health concerns. She met with Youth A on 02/17/2023 and
Youth A denied the allegation of inappropriate touching with
peers. Youth A’s Foster Care Specialist did not express any
concerns regarding staff or supervision.
I interviewed Youth B’s Foster Care Specialist 2 via telephone on
03/01/2023. Youth B is currently in an independent living program
(ILP). He said Youth B has been in the IL program since
01/27/2023. He met with Youth B last week and Youth B denied
any inappropriate touching while she was placed at the facility.
3

I interviewed Youth D’s Foster Care Specialist 3 via telephone on
03/06/2023. Foster Care Specialist said she spoke with Youth D
and Youth D denied any inappropriate touching with another
youths. She said Youth D reported feeling safe and did not
express any concerns regarding any staff members.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 03/09/2023. Staff 1 is a direct
care worker and has been working at the facility for 3 months. He
said in late December Youth B told him that Youth A is very
touchy with her. He never saw the two youths do any
inappropriate touching. He informed the supervisor, and an
incident report was completed.
I interviewed Youth B on 03/17/2023. Youth B requested to be
interviewed via telephone. Youth B reported she was discharged
from the facility on 01/27/2023. She denied any inappropriate
touching between her and Youth A. She didn’t like that Youth A
had rubbed her leg when they were watching television, so she
told staff and Youth A was moved to a different wing. She denied
any inappropriate touching occurred in the bathroom involving
Youth A or any other resident. She was agitated during the
interview and said she is tired of people questioning her about
Youth A. She reported no concerns or issues with supervision
while she was at the facility.
On 3/6/23 Foster Care Specialist 1 shared a new concern that an
unidentified staff told Youth A to kill herself on an unidentified
date. I interviewed Rights Officer on 03/09/2023, who said he
addressed Youth A’s claim against Staff 2 last month. After
looking into the matter, Rights Officer said there were no
witnesses and nothing to support that Staff 2 said this. Upon
interviewing Staff 2, Rights Officer said she denied telling Youth A
to kill herself. Instead, as Youth A announced she was going to
her room, Staff 2 supported the youth’s decision, remarking, “Do
what you have to do to calm down.”
I interviewed Youth A again on 03/09/2023. Youth A said that last
month she was upset but could not recall why she was angry. She
told Staff 2 she said she was going to her room to self-harm and
Staff 2 told her “I don’t care if you kill yourself.” Youth A said she
told the Supervisor about the incident. Youth A was asked what
happens if she is talking about self-harming and she said staff call
the nurse and doctor.
4

I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer on 03/09/2023. He reported
there was an incident reported completed by the Supervisor dated
02/05/2023. He reviewed the incident reported and spoke with
Staff 2. He said Staff 2 said Youth A was agitated and said she
was going to her room and Staff 2 told her, “Do what you have to
do to calm down.” Consumer Rights Officer reported Youth A is
on a one to one due to her mental health.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 at the facility on 03/28/2023. She
reported on 02/05/2023 Youth A was agitated and was being
aggressive with other residents and Staff. Youth A told Supervisor
1 that Staff 2 told her to kill herself. Supervisor 1 denied
witnessing or hearing Staff 2 say that to Youth A. Supervisor said
an incident report was completed and she contacted the on-call
nurse.
I interviewed Staff 2 via telephone on 03/30/2023. Staff 2 is a
direct care worker and has been working at the facility for one
year. Staff 2 reported on the day in question Youth A was irritated
and arguing with the other residents on the wing. She tried to talk
to Youth A to calm down, but Youth A walked away and said she
was going to her bedroom. Staff 2 said she told Youth A, “do what
you have to do to calm down.” A few minutes later Youth A came
out of her bedroom and told Staff 2, “you told me to kill myself.”
Staff 2 said she has been working in residential programs for over
40 years and would never say that to any youth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated 12/26/2022, written by Supervisor 1.
Youth B reported she is uncomfortable on her wing
because Youth A tried to rub her hand on her leg. No
further concerns reported. Youths were placed on different
wings and consumer rights officer was notified.
• Consumer Rights Officers notes dated 12/29/2022. Youth A
reported she did rub Youth B leg under the blanket while
staff were sitting behind them. Youth B reported that Youth
A was rubbing her leg under the blanket. As a safety
measure the two youths were placed on different wings and
the two youths were not to have any contact given the
allegations that were made. Staff were advised that if
youths require blankets in the sitting area, that it is one
blanket per seating arrangement. Also, the chairs/couches
or any other items should never be blocking staff
supervision.
• Screenshots of the video dated 12/26/2022. Two staff
members are sitting behind the couch that the two youths
5

are sitting on, with one blanket over the two youth’s laps
and hands.
• Youth A’s treatment plan dated 02/07/2023. Youth is on 1:1
supervision starting 01/03/2023 through 04/03/2023 due to
safety concerns including physically aggressive behaviors,
self-harmful behaviors, increased mood lability, increased
impulsive behaviors and an inability to demonstrate
consistent emotionally regulated behaviors.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is insufficient
evidence that staff were not supervising or were aware of
inappropriate touching by Youth A. On 12/26/2026, Youth B
reported Youth A had rubbed her leg when they were sitting on a
sofa watching television. As a safety measure the two youths
were placed on different wings and the two youths were not to
have any contact given the allegations that were made. Youth A
reported that she had kissed Youth C in the bathroom, but Youth
C denied any inappropriate contact with Youth A. Based on the
interview of the Youths, staff, and review of documentation it could
not be determined if any inappropriate touching occurred. The
facility took the appropriate actions and placed the youths on
different wings.
The facility is in compliance with the additional allegation about
staff telling Youth A to kill herself. Staff report Youth A was
agitated and said she was going to her room and Staff said, “do
what you have to do to calm down.” Youth A said staff told her “I
don’t care if you kill yourself.” The Supervisor interviewed denied
hearing the staff say that to the youth. There were no other
witnesses, therefore it could not be determined that staff said that
to the youth.
Consultation:
It is recommended that all staff be advised that they need to
ensure there no barriers (chairs, couch, blankets, etc.) blocking
their view of the youths.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
